body_html:
That is great. This is a bit insider information but the 384.x device driver will be supported for CUDA 10 until likely atleast Q2 next year although it is not supported by CUDA 9.1 and 9.2. There will be a 400 "series" driver released with CUDA 10 as well.

I understand your situation is different. For an enterprise staying on a set of drivers as long a possible is desired. If I was gaming and doing ML (as I do at home) and on Windows (I duel boot linux) I would be on the latest driver like yourself. This does not help you and I understand this is painful at times.
